review: Sadly the Fire TV stick has a bad habit of overheating on us. I'm not sure why either! When that happens everything slows down and it just is a pain in the arse. I have to unplug it from power, and the tv to let it cool down before we can use it again. Ah well, in the end it's nice to have something that's faster than the Wii at playing Netflix and Youtube... though I'm starting to wonder if there is something better suited for us out there.

review: Bought the Fire TV Stick from Best Buy when they ran an aggressive sale. Hooked it up and it did not work, no power, nothing. Life events caused us to delay further troubleshooting for a few weeks. Then we tried on other TVs with the same result.  Attempted a return to Best Buy but we were beyond their return window.  So we contacted Amazon under their 1-year warranty program.  Dealing with Fire TV customer service was challenging to say the least.  I was first told it was a Best Buy problem, not Amazon; then was told Amazon would replace it; then was told Amazon would not replace it.  But perseverance and patience paid off and Amazon eventually decided to do the right thing and replace their defective unit.  Replacement eventually arrived and this unit worked flawlessly. So my 7 year old Sony is now a smart TV -- really enjoying the experience!

review: I ordered a new firestick, and when I plugged it into my tv, it came up registered to someone else. Clearly this was not a new product, but a refurbished one, being sold to me as new. I tried it anyway, and after less than 2 weeks it randomly stopped working. I went to amazon to order a replacement, but they said they could not help me with that and I would have to contact the fire TV support team. They gave me a link to a Q&A; page for firestick, with no way to contact the merchant for help. I am returning this product now and will not be ordering another one!!
author: Amazon Customer
